snippet: Hissène Habré, who led the country from 1982 to 1990, is being prosecuted abroad after a 19-month investigation into the deaths of thousands.
abstract: Senegalese tribunal announces that human rights trial of Hissene Habre, former president of Chad, will soon begin on charges that include crimes against humanity, war crimes and torture; Habre is accused of overseeing deaths of thousands during his time in power before fleeing Chad to Senegal in 1990; will be first African trial to rely on 'universal jurisdiction' rules.
lead_paragraph: Hissène Habré, who led the country from 1982 to 1990, is being prosecuted abroad after a 19-month investigation into the deaths of thousands.

headline.main: Trial on War Crimes Is Set for Ex-President of Chad
headline.print_headline: Trial on War Crimes Is Set for Ex-President of Chad

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
